body: The downside of this custom literal is that it incurs additional run-time cost, but this is 100% fine if we're just building up static containers of symbols (you pay it once anyway). If a symbol only appears in such cases then I think there's no point in polluting the default list, and this is what I did here with e.g. `_sigmoid_backward`.
